page.title: 03EDWARD JENNER
page.content: Berkeley is famous as the home of Dr Edward Jenner who discovered vaccination. Jenner was the son of the vicar of Berkeley and it was as a result of practising medicine in this area at the end of the 18th century that he noticed that dairy maids on the farms rarely suffered badly from smallpox. It was this that led him to vaccinate a boy called James Phipps with cowpox and then to try, unsuccessfully, to give him smallpox. It took many years for the value of vaccination to be appreciated in England. Nowadays we have the Jenner Museum in Berkeley. This is owned by the Jenner Trust who have been able to build a new museum and medical conference centre.
